column4: Has anyone installed MATLAB on ubuntu before I can seem to be able to run the installer as root user so ti reaches a point where it says it can not create the directory to put the MATLAB stuff into
but it doesnt work
how can i run and installer as a root user? even though i am the only user
ya but the installer is a gui
gksudo theinstaller
i do that and the terminal is doings something but the installer never pops up
its possiuble it dident make one.. if it did not come as a .deb
look to see if it installed a .desktop file somewhere.
or just make a launcher/.desktop file for it
i dont know how to do that, :(
dont do that chmod command......
it could break things badly.. and theres no point inb doing that to /usr/share/
learn to use 'sudo' and 'gksudo' as needed to access system directories
ok but i tried using gksudo to install MATLAB but it did not start the installer it just paused then did nothing so i cant write to the /usr/local/ that it needs to be in
its possible theres a deeper bug in the installer. OR you could just install it to your users home dir.
you dont just go around doing chmod 777 to system directories and hope things work. :)
haha. i tried but i dont know what i did wrong it says no such file or directory exist when i click the launcher
CaSe Is ImpoRnatnT in LinUx  for onething..
watch out for spaces in paths/filenames also.

i know but i just copied the instructions given on the matlab ubuntu set up page ... https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MATLAB is there any chance they did something wrong? im guessing no that it must have been me
could be a typo. or its out of date due to changes in matlab.
it pays to pay attention and learn what its doing not just follow directions blindly
ya i know but sometimes when the directions dont help all i can do is follow blindly
